question: William has 70 square meters of blueberry field. There are 30 blueberrys per square meter. William can harvest his blueberrys every 6 months. How many blueberrys can William harvest within a year?
answer:
William has 30*70= <<30*70=2100>>2100 blueberrys on his field.
William can harvest his blueberrys 12 / 6 = <<12/6=2>>2 times per year
Therefore William can harvest 2100*2 = <<2100*2=4200>>4200 blueberrys per year.
#### 4200
